quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Towns and List
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, towns, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Splendid lunch, but now I need a nap! Before we go, can you tell me which of these towns does not exist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Barclay, ME

questions.question: Help me with this list, one of these towns does not exist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: W. Memphis, TN

questions.question: Before we go to lunch, lets knock out one more list. Ya get it right, I buy you lunch!  Hows that for a deal?  Here, youll probably need this list, so you can spot the fake town on it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eden Prarie, MT

questions.question: Oklahoma has borders with how may other states?
Is Harare the capital of Niger?
One of these towns is about as fake as that clip - on tie youre wearing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carruthers, SC

questions.question: Alaska is also called Golden West.
Which town on this list is fake?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Proctors Corner, VA

questions.question: Here, have a go at this while we wait to order.  These towns all look good to me, but what do I know?  One of them is fake.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kentfield, ND

questions.question: Switzerland has borders with France, Germany, Italy, Austria and which other country?
Lets look at this next file.  One of these towns aint kosher, pal! Which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Menlo, CT

questions.question: Three of these US cities are real, the fourth is a fake.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Illiad, AR

questions.question: The English county of Yorkshire was originally split into 3 districts that bordered each other. These districts were historically called, Ridings. Which of these was not one of the historic Ridings?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Riding

questions.question: Take a good look, one of these US cities is as counterfeit as that fiver you spent on coffee this morning!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Orange, NJ

questions.question: Drat, I hate when the phone rings so early! Got another list for ya.  Who could imagine thered be so many fake towns out there!? Can you spot the fake one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Albins, MO

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: June and Month
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, carolina, june. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these is a nickname of West Virginia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mountain State

questions.question: In the United States, June is National Safety Month.
Margaux Hemingway, who plays a fashion model in the movie Lipstick, died in the month of June. What did she die from?
Which of these states is called The Cactus State?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Mexico

questions.question: What day is Flag Day celebrated on in the United States?
In the United States, Fathers Day is celebrated on the 2nd Sunday of June.
What is Nebraskas nickname?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cornhusker State

questions.question: June is Lane Courtesy Month in the United States.
Prince and Keenan Ivory Wayans were born on June 7th 1958.
Actress Darla Hood, who appeared in the Our Gang films, died at the age of 47 in the month of June.
What Roman Goddess is the month of June named after?
South Carolina is also called The Land of Milk and Honey.
Marilyn Monroe and Pat Boone were born on the same day in June, but not in the same year.
Which of these is an unofficial nickname of South Dakota?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sunshine State

questions.question: Hawaii is not considered a part of North America.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Seattle and City
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, nickname, lakes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What large river forms most of the border between the states of South Carolina and Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Savannah River

questions.question: What animal is the official mascot of the baseball team the Seattle Mariners?
Which of these songs, referring to Seattle, was recorded by the famous grunge band Nirvana?

options.text: Frances Farmer Will Have Her Revenge On Seattle

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frances Farmer Will Have Her Revenge On Seattle

questions.question: Which of these lakes is not part of the Great Lakes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Salt Lake

questions.question: Which of these is not a symbol of the city of Seattle?

options.text: Seattle the Peerless City - official song

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Excelsior! - official motto

questions.question: Which of these is a sister city to Seattle, Washington?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reykjavík, Iceland

questions.question: The Space Needle, Seattles 184-meter high symbol, is featured in the logo of which popular sitcom?
Seattle, Washington, is regarded as the birth place of what style of music?
Which of these statements about Seattle, Washington, is NOT true?

options.text: The original settlement, later to become Seattle, was initially called New York.
Seattle is the capital of the State of Washington.
In 2005 Seattle was proclaimed the most literate city in the USA.
Three people committed suicide jumping from the Space Needle in the 1970s.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seattle is the capital of the State of Washington.

questions.question: Seattle was named after the Native American chief Seattle who belonged to what tribe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Suquamish

questions.question: What is the official nickname of Seattle, a city in the State of Washington?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Emerald City

questions.question: The 1993 movie Sleepless in Seattle starred Tom Hanks and which famous actress?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meg Ryan

questions.question: What is the largest saltwater lake in the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Salt Lake

questions.question: What mountain range is Mt. Rushmore located in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Hills

questions.question: Which man made lake lies in North Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lake Lanier

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Ship and Ships
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, ship, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which ship was named after the consort of George V of the United Kingdom and sailed the North Atlantic Ocean from 1936 to 1967?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen Mary

questions.question: This notorious passenger steamer was first launched in 1865. On the evening of September 3, 1878, it collided with another vessel and sank in the Thames.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Princess Alice

questions.question: Lusitania and Mauretania were sister ships, built to compete with fast German liners. Which one of them was torpedoed and sunk by a German submarine in 1915?

This famous French ocean liner was launched in 1932 and received a lot of applause. It was the first liner to surpass 60,000 tons, the first ship with 1,000 feet of length and the first to make an Atlantic crossing with an average speed of over 30 knots.
This 8,600-ton transatlantic passenger steamship became famous after rescuing the survivors after the sinking of Titanic.
What was special about Jacques-Yves Cousteaus ship Calypso, which was originally built for the British Royal Navy?

options.text: She sank mysteriously and was never seen again
She was equipped as a mobile laboratory for field research

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was equipped as a mobile laboratory for field research

questions.question: Three of the following vessels are sister ships. Which one does not belong to the group?
In 1620, this ship made a historical voyage from Plymouth, England to North Virginia, transporting the Pilgrims to America.
All of these vessels except one are famous steam-powered ships crossing the Atlantic Ocean. Name the odd vessel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cutty Sark

questions.question: The highest waterfall on the planet, the Angel Falls, is located on this continent.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South America

questions.question: The US shares water borders with all but one of these countries. Which is the odd one?
What US state is situated to the East of the Bering Strait?
What river connects Lake Ontario, one of the Great Lakes, to the Atlantic Ocean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Lawrence River

questions.question: Christopher Columbus went on his first voyage across the Atlantic Ocean in 1492, using three famous ships. Which of the following was not among them?
The Great Plains lie west of this river and east of the Rocky Mountains.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mississippi River

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Continent and World
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, country, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Republic of Djibouti is a small country located in the northeastern part of this continent.
On what continent is the largest fresh water reserve on the planet located?
The Eiffel Tower in France was named after its designer.
On what continent is the Yoruba language spoken as a native language of the indigenous people?
The capybara, the largest extant rodent species on the planet, is endemic to this continent.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South America

questions.question: The Great Wall of China is one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
The Statue of Liberty was sculpted by Gustave Eiffel.
The Jutland Peninsula, a.k.a. the Cimbrian Peninsula in the past, is located in this continent.
The Amur River, the ninth longest river in the world, is located on this continent.
The Leaning Tower of Pisa is the bell tower of the Cathedral in Pisa.
The most populous country in the world is in this continent.
On what continent is the Great Victoria Desert located?
The Roman Coliseum was completed under emperor Nero.
On what continent is the city of Puebla located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North America

questions.question: Taj Mahal is located in Bombay, India.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: South America and Monster Mash
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, amazon, babylon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: With the Louisiana Purchase of 1803 America was able to double the size of its territory, and for a bargain price to boot. Who was the generous salesman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Napoleon Bonaparte as First Consul

questions.question: The construction of the Lighthouse of Alexandria was initiated by Alexander the Great.
What is the official language of the smallest sovereign state of South America, Suriname?
Stonehenge is a prehistoric monument located in Scotland.
The novelty song Monster Mash is narrated by whom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Mad Scientist

questions.question: In what year was the Halloween novelty song Monster Mash released?
One of the most notable civilizations of pre-Columbian America was the Inca Empire. The Incas referred to their king by what title?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Child of the sun

questions.question: Which of these is a music genre NOT typical for South America?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: The Amazon River is the largest river in the world by volume. Because of its dimensions it has been nicknamed The River Sea. What width does the Amazon River reach at its widest point during the dry season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 11 km (7 mi)

questions.question: With 51% of the continents population, Spanish is the most widely spoken language in South America.
Which of the following South American countries is paired with the wrong capital?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colombia - Santiago

questions.question: What makes the South American Atacama Desert one of the driest places on Earth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The proximity to the Andes

questions.question: The Hanging Gardens of Babylon were built by Nebuchadnezzar II.
At the record altitude of 3,600 meters (11,811 feet), La Paz, serves as capital of which South American country?
The Statue of Liberty was given by the Italian people to the American people.
